newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: France's Publicis to buy 60 pct of Eureka.
newsitem.headline: France's Publicis to buy 60 pct of Eureka.

text.p: French advertising group Publicis has bought a controlling 60 percent stake in Singapore-based agency Eureka Advertising, a spokesman for Eureka said on Tuesday.
Details of the merger would be announced later on Tuesday, the spokesman told Reuters in response to telephone enquiries.

The International Herald Tribune newspaper said on Tuesday the deal was Publicis's first foray into the Asian market since it launched a global expansion strategy after splitting with its former partner, True North Communications Inc, nearly a year ago.
The spokesman said Eureka expected a turnover of some Singapore $30 billion in its 1997 financial year. He declined to give further details.
